timeline.message: Extract logic to a separate method in EncoderUtil
Add test of 8-value blocks to block encoding test

Improve deserialization performance of long blocks

8 `is null` values are checked at once before null data is converted to boolean[].
If the value is 0 or 0xFF then we can either ignore or copy all 8 values at once.

before
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                    0  avgt   60   1,182 ± 0,015  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .01  avgt   60   3,091 ± 0,081  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .10  avgt   60   3,823 ± 0,076  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .50  avgt   60   2,667 ± 0,014  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .90  avgt   60   3,435 ± 0,016  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .99  avgt   60   2,317 ± 0,039  ns/op

after
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                    0  avgt   60  1,140 ± 0,007  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .01  avgt   60  2,494 ± 0,011  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .10  avgt   60  3,939 ± 0,028  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .50  avgt   60  2,723 ± 0,017  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .90  avgt   60  3,199 ± 0,017  ns/op
BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeLong                  .99  avgt   60  1,413 ± 0,011  ns/op

after:

BenchmarkBlockSerde.deserializeInt96                 .10  avgt   60  4,806 ± 0,043  ns/op

timeline.bodyText: Why not use similar 8-bits null check as in in other serdes?
timeline.author: sopel39

replies.bodyText: It turns out to be slower. I guess more data means less time spent on null checking and more on actual memory copying.
replies.author: skrzypo987
